  • Method Details

    • getRuleSet

      RuleSet getRuleSet()
      Used to get the parameters to regulate various aspects of the game
      Returns:
      the rule set of the game

    • getPlayers

      Set<String> getPlayers()
      Retrieves the nicknames of all the players of the current game.

      The nickname is unique in the game and can be used to identify each specific Player .

      Nicknames are chosen at the beginning of the game.

      Returns:
      a set of the nicknames of the players

    • getCurrentTurnPlayer

      String getCurrentTurnPlayer() throws GameStatusException
      Retrieves the nickname of the player whose turn it is.

      If the game has not been initialized with the method .initGame this method returns null .

      Returns:
      the nickname of the player that is playing
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game hasn't started or has ended

    • getFirstPlayer

      String getFirstPlayer() throws GameStatusException
      Retrieves the nickname of the player that is first in the order of the turns

      If the game has not been initialized with the method .initGame this method returns null

      Returns:
      the nickname of the player that played the first turn
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game hasn't started or has ended

    • getPlayerHand

      Set<Integer> getPlayerHand (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws GameStatusException, PlayerInitException
      Retrieves the identifier (ID) of all the PlayableCards in a specific player hand. The player is identified by his nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - Nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      a List of the IDs of the PlayableCards in the player hand
      Throws:
      GameStatusException
      PlayerInitException

    • getPlayerObjective

      Set<Integer> getPlayerObjective (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException
      Each player can have one or more personal objectives represented by the ObjectiveCards.

      This method retrieves the identifier (ID) of all the PlayableCards in a specific player hand.

      The player is identified by his nickname.

      Parameters:
      nickname - Nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      a List of the IDs of the ObjectiveCards of the player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException
      GameStatusException

    • getPlayerColor

      PlayerColor getPlayerColor (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException
      Each player has an assigned color for his pawn.
      Parameters:
      nickname - Nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the PlayerColor of the player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException

    • getPositionedCard

      Map<Position,CardContainer> getPositionedCard (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException
      Return a Map that has Positions as keys and CardContainers as values, it represents the field of a player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      a map with the positions and the cards placed on the field
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException - if the player is not found
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing

    • getAvailablePositions

      Set<Position> getAvailablePositions (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException
      For placing a card on the field, a set of conditions has to be satisfied.

      The new card needs to touch at least one of the corners of another placed card, and all the corners of placed cards touched by the new card have to not be NOT_USABLE.

      This method retrieves the positions that satisfy these conditions.

      Parameters:
      nickname - Nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the Set of Positions that are available for placing a card in the field
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException
      GameStatusException

    • getCommonObjectives

      @NotNull @NotNull Set<Integer> getCommonObjectives() throws GameStatusException
      During a game, players have objectives in common
      Returns:
      a set of ID of ObjectiveCard that represent the common objectives
      Throws:
      GameStatusException

    • getExposedCards

      Set<Integer> getExposedCards (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type) throws GameStatusException
      Return a Set of cardIDs, it represents the cards of PlayableCardType that are on their front on the table
      Parameters:
      type - type of the card to be shown
      Returns:
      a set of card IDs
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing

    • getPlayerPoints

      int getPlayerPoints (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException, GameBreakingException
      Retrive the points that a player has obtained since the start of the game
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the points of the player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException
      GameStatusException
      GameBreakingException

    • getPlayerFinishingPosition

      int getPlayerFinishingPosition (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException, GameBreakingException
      Retrieve the ranking of a player at the end of the game, there could be more player with the same ranking
      Parameters:
      nickname - of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the position in the leaderboard of the player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException
      GameStatusException
      GameBreakingException

    • getWinner

      Set<String> getWinner() throws GameStatusException
      This method returns the winners, there could be more than on winners.
      Returns:
      a set with the names of the winners
      Throws:
      GameStatusException

    • initGame

      void initGame() throws NumOfPlayersException, GameStatusException, GameBreakingException
      This method initializes a new game, it has to be called after all the players have joined the games This method shuffles the players Set to randomize the turn order, it chooses the first player, it clears the field, the hand, and the objectives for each player, it resets the plateau and the pickableTable.
      Throws:
      NumOfPlayersException - If there aren't at least two players in the game
      GameStatusException - if a game is in progress
      GameBreakingException

    • addPlayerToTable

      void addPlayerToTable (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname, @NotNull @NotNull PlayerColor colour) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException, NumOfPlayersException
      This method can be used to add a new player in the game during the setting-up phase.

      A player can choose his nickname and color.

      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the new player
      colour - color of the new player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException - if there is another player with the chosen nickname, if the color is already taken, if the limit of players per game has already been reached
      GameStatusException - if a game is in progress
      NumOfPlayersException

    • removePlayer

      void removePlayer (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws GameStatusException
      Remove a player from the player list if present, else it does nothing.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if a game is in progress

    • setStarterFor

      void setStarterFor (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname, boolean isRetro) throws IllegalCardPlacingException, GameStatusException, PlayerInitException, GameBreakingException
      Each player needs a StartingCard at the beginning of the game. This method places the picked one on the field
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      isRetro - tell if the StartingCard is placed on the front (false) or on the back (true)
      Throws:
      IllegalCardPlacingException - if there is already a card in that position
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing
      PlayerInitException
      GameBreakingException

    • setObjectiveFor

      void setObjectiveFor (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname, int cardID) throws IllegalPlayerSpaceActionException, GameStatusException, PlayerInitException, GameBreakingException
      Set a new personal objective for a player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      cardID - identifier of the ObjectiveCard to be assigned to the player
      Throws:
      IllegalPlayerSpaceActionException - if there are already too many objectives
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing
      PlayerInitException
      GameBreakingException

    • placeCard

      void placeCard (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname, int cardID, @NotNull @NotNull Position position, boolean isRetro) throws IllegalCardPlacingException, TurnsOrderException, IllegalPlateauActionException, GameStatusException, NotInHandException, PlayerInitException
      This method is used to place new playable cards on the field
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      cardID - identifier of the card to be placed
      position - position where the player wants to place the card
      isRetro - false if the card has to be placed with the front facing up, true otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalCardPlacingException - if the card can't be placed in that position
      TurnsOrderException - if it's not that player turn
      IllegalPlateauActionException - if there isn't any player with that nickname
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing
      NotInHandException
      PlayerInitException

    • drawFromDeckOf

      int drawFromDeckOf (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type, @NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws GameStatusException, TurnsOrderException, GameBreakingException, EmptyDeckException, PlayerInitException, MaxHandSizeException, IllegalPickActionException
      This method is used to draw a card from the deck of the specified type
      Parameters:
      type - type of the card to be drawn
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the ID of the card drawn
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game is not started
      TurnsOrderException - if it's not that player turn
      GameBreakingException - if there are discrepancies between plateau and gameLogic
      EmptyDeckException - if the deck is empty
      PlayerInitException - if the player is not found
      MaxHandSizeException - if the player hand is already full
      IllegalPickActionException - if the player hasn't placed a card yet

    • goNextTurn

      void goNextTurn() throws GameBreakingException, GameStatusException
      This method handles the changing of the turn and the final turn. If it is not the final turn, it checks if it's armageddonTime and gives the turn to the next players. If it's the final turn, it ends the game and prepares the final leaderboard.
      Throws:
      GameBreakingException - if there are discrepancies between plateau and gameLogic
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing

    • drawVisibleOf

      int drawVisibleOf (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type, @NotNull @NotNull String nickname, int cardID) throws GameStatusException, TurnsOrderException, GameBreakingException, IllegalPlayerSpaceActionException, IllegalPickActionException, PlayerInitException
      Used to draw a card from the visible cards of the specified type
      Parameters:
      type - type of the card to be drawn
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      cardID - ID of the card to be drawn
      Returns:
      the ID of the card drawn
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game has not started
      TurnsOrderException - if it's not that player turn
      GameBreakingException - if there are discrepancies between plateau and gameLogic
      IllegalPlayerSpaceActionException - if the player hand is already full
      IllegalPickActionException - if the player hasn't placed a card yet
      PlayerInitException - if the player is not found

    • forceEnd

      void forceEnd()
      Ends the current game and gives the possibility to add or remove players.

      It doesn't clear the current state of the game. Doesn't calculate final points.

      It must be called with an initGame for reinitialization

    • getStatus

      GameStatus getStatus()
      Retrieves the current game status
      Returns:
      the current game status as an enum
      See Also:
      • GameStatus

    • getDeckTop

      Optional<GameColor> getDeckTop (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type) throws GameStatusException
      Used to get the Color on the top of the specified card.
      Parameters:
      type - type of the card
      Returns:
      the color of the top card
      Throws:
      GameStatusException - if the game is not ongoing

    • getCandidateObjectives

      Set<Integer> getCandidateObjectives (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException
      Used to get a Set of the candidate objectives of the specified player
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      a set of the IDs of the candidate objectives
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException - if the player is not found
      GameStatusException - if the objectives have not been dealt with yet

    • getStarterCard

      Optional<Integer> getStarterCard (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname) throws PlayerInitException, GameStatusException
      Each player will get assigned a specific starter card, this method retrieves it.
      Parameters:
      nickname - Nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      the StarterCard assigned to the player
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException - if there is no player with that nickname
      GameStatusException

      Parameters:

      playerListener - listener to be added

      This method is used to add a listener to the model, it will be notified

    • disconnectPlayer

      void disconnectPlayer (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname)
      This method is used to disconnect a player from the game
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest

    • reconnectPlayer

      void reconnectPlayer (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname, @NotNull @NotNull PlayerListener playerListener) throws PlayerInitException
      This method is used to reconnect a player to the game
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      playerListener - listener to be added
      Throws:
      PlayerInitException - if there is no player with that nickname that can reconnect

      boolean isDisconnected (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname)
      To check if a player is currently disconnected
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
      Returns:
      true if the player is disconnected, false otherwise

      This method is used to end the game early, it will calculate the final points and the

    • save

      @NotNull @NotNull GameModelMemento save()
      Used to save the current state of the game
      Returns:
      a data structure that contains all the information necessary to restore the game to the current state

    • load

      void load (@NotNull @NotNull GameModelMemento memento)
      Used to load an old game to the model, the current model will be replaced by the one in the memento
      Parameters:
      memento - the data structure that contains the state of the game

    • reSyncWith

      void reSyncWith (@NotNull @NotNull String nickname)
      Used tu update the client with the information of the loaded game
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player of interest
